intro: Montanoa heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf montanoa, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or wooded areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are notable for their variation in shape and size, which contributes to its common name. Montanoa heterophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its showy yellow flowers.
